p.s: Not everyone can go out and buy the latest hybrid model .
However , you can learn how to easily increase your gas mileage with your current car .
Driving well and taking good care of your vehicle are all it takes to go further on a tank of gas .

item.s: Drive the speed limit .
Experts estimate that you lose 20 cents for every you go over the highway speed limit .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 1.jpg

item.s: Use your vehicle 's cruise control for highway driving .
The cruise control keeps the accelerator even and prevents sudden surges from stepping on the gas .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 2.jpg

item.s: Cruise control wo n't work in favor of your gas mileage if you live in a mountainous area , as the accelerator will be constantly surging going up frequent steep hills .
Shut the car off if you 'll be idling for longer than 15-30 seconds .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 3.jpg

item.s: Drive moderately and do n't rev the engine .
Anticipate having to stop and slow down way ahead of traffic .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 4.jpg

item.s: Change your oil regularly and rotate or replace your tires when needed .
A dirty air filter or worn-out spark plugs can also seriously drain your gas mileage and should be fixed or replaced .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 5.jpg

item.s: Use the motor oil recommended in your vehicle owner 's manual .
Motor oil additives can also make a difference .
Look for an oil in your car 's recommended grade that advertises energy conservation or uses the API performance logo .
Check your vehicle owner 's manual to see what octane of fuel is recommended for your vehicle ; for most cars , regular octane is ideal .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 6.jpg

item.s: Reduce engine speed by using the highest gear available .
Not only will this easily increase your gas mileage , it will also reduce the wear and tear on your engine .
Do n't use a gear that is too high .
Take luggage and racks off the exterior of your car when you 're not using them .
Anything extra on the outside of your vehicle increases drag .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 8.jpg

item.s: Remove unnecessary junk from your trunk , as extra pounds will weigh a car down .
It 's estimated that for every 250 pounds hauled , you lose per gallon .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 9.jpg

item.s: Travel when you know traffic will be lighter , if possible .
Combine trips to run several errands at once in certain areas of town .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 10.jpg

item.s: Try not to use your four-wheel drive if possible .
The drive components increase fuel consumption .
Keep your tires inflated at optimum levels .
Not only is this good for the wear of your car and safety , you may be able to get a modest increase in gas mileage .

figure.rend: Easily Increase Your Gas Mileage Step 12.jpg

item.s: On the highway , always keep your revs below 3000rpm , this will reduce the amount of gas being used to move the vehicle .
Keep track of your fuel savings by saving receipts and calculating your fuel economy over distances traveled .
Make notes about which gas mileage saving methods you tried and their result .
Avoid any fuel additives that claim it can easily increase your gas mileage .
The Federal Trade Commission warns that any savings from these products will be minimal .
Rolling down the windows and forgoing air conditioning made no difference in tests of gas consumption .
